name: University of Aberdeen
description:
Founded in 1495, the University of Aberdeen is Scotland's third-oldest university and the fifth oldest in the UK. Known for its historic charm and modern research facilities, it is ranked among the Top 20 universities in the UK. The university combines a rich heritage with a forward-thinking approach, offering a world-class student experience in the vibrant city of Aberdeen.

The university is organized into three colleges: Arts and Social Sciences, Life Sciences and Medicine, and Physical Sciences. It is renowned for its research in energy, health, and data science. The stunning King's College campus features ancient architecture, while the Foresterhill campus is one of Europe's largest health campuses.
entryRequirements: Entry requirements vary by program. Typical offers for UK students range from AAB to BBB at A-level, or AAAB to AABB at Higher. The university is committed to widening access and offers contextual admissions for eligible students. International Baccalaureate: 32-34 points.
accommodation: All new students are guaranteed accommodation. The main student village at Hillhead offers a mix of catered and self-catered options, creating a lively community atmosphere. It is located a short walk or bus ride from the main King's College campus.
international: Aberdeen welcomes students from over 130 countries. The university offers a dedicated International Centre, visa support, and a range of scholarships for international students. The 'Aberdeen Family' program connects students with local families for cultural exchange.
studentLife: With over 150 sports clubs and societies, student life is vibrant. The Aberdeen Sports Village is a world-class facility. The city offers a mix of historic culture, sandy beaches, and a bustling city center with excellent nightlife and dining.
admissions: Applications are handled via UCAS. The university values personal statements and references highly. Medicine and Education courses may require interviews. Clearing places are often available for qualified applicants.

travelInfo.train: Aberdeen Railway Station is in the city center, with direct links to Edinburgh, Glasgow, and London.
travelInfo.bus: Frequent bus services (Routes 1, 2, 20) connect the city center to the King's College and Foresterhill campuses.
airports: Aberdeen International Airport (Dyce) - 20 mins by taxi/bus
travelInfo.localTransport: The city is compact and walkable. Cycling is popular, with many dedicated paths.

faculties: College of Arts and Social Sciences
College of Life Sciences and Medicine

name: Aberystwyth University
description:
Aberystwyth University is a historic institution located on the stunning coast of West Wales. Founded in 1872, it was the first university college in Wales and is known for its friendly community and research excellence. The university offers a unique learning environment where students can enjoy both academic rigor and a high quality of life by the sea.

The university is structured into three faculties: Arts and Social Sciences, Business and Physical Sciences, and Earth and Life Sciences. It is particularly renowned for its International Politics department (the first of its kind in the world) and the Institute of Biological, Environmental and Rural Sciences (IBERS).
entryRequirements: Typical offers range from BBB to CCC. The university is committed to widening access and offers a range of scholarships and bursaries. It also accepts the Welsh Baccalaureate and offers entrance exams for scholarships.
accommodation: Aberystwyth offers guaranteed accommodation for all first-year students. Options range from sea-view rooms in the iconic seafront residences to budget-friendly halls on the main Penglais campus. The Fferm Penglais student village offers high-quality studio apartments.
international: Aberystwyth has a long history of welcoming international students. The university offers a dedicated International Student Support team, English language courses, and a friendly, inclusive community.
studentLife: The Students' Union is the hub of social life, with over 100 societies and sports clubs. The town is famous for its safe and friendly atmosphere, with plenty of pubs, cafes, and the National Library of Wales right on the doorstep.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. The university values individual potential and considers each application holistically. They often make unconditional offers to students with strong predicted grades.

travelInfo.train: Aberystwyth station is in the town center, with direct trains to Birmingham (3h) and Shrewsbury (1h 30m).
travelInfo.bus: TrawsCymru buses connect Aberystwyth to other parts of Wales.
travelInfo.localTransport: The town is compact and walkable. The university offers a regular bus service up the hill to the main campus.

faculties: Faculty of Arts and Social Sciences
Faculty of Business and Physical Sciences
Faculty of Earth and Life Sciences

name: Abertay University
description:
Abertay University is a modern, forward-thinking university located in the heart of Dundee, Scotland's sunniest city. It is world-renowned for its computer games and cybersecurity courses, having launched the world's first computer games degree in 1997. Abertay offers a close-knit, friendly community where students are treated as individuals, not numbers.

The university is structured into the Faculty of Design, Informatics and Business, and the Faculty of Social and Applied Sciences. It focuses on preparing students for the world of work, with a strong emphasis on practical skills and industry links.
entryRequirements: Typical offers range from BBB to CCC at Higher/A-level. The university is known for its inclusive approach and considers a wide range of qualifications, including HNC/HNDs for advanced entry.
accommodation: Abertay offers a range of accommodation options, all within walking distance of the campus and city center. Guaranteed accommodation for first-year students. Parker House and Meadowside Halls are popular choices.
international: Abertay welcomes students from over 60 countries. It offers a friendly and supportive environment for international students, with English language support and a dedicated international team.
studentLife: The Students' Association supports a variety of societies, with a strong focus on gaming and technology. Dundee is a vibrant student city with a low cost of living, featuring the V&A Dundee museum and a lively waterfront.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. The university values creativity and innovation, especially for its games and arts courses which may require a portfolio.

travelInfo.train: Dundee Railway Station is a 10-minute walk away, with direct trains to Edinburgh, Glasgow, and London.
travelInfo.bus: Dundee Bus Station is just 5 minutes from campus.
travelInfo.localTransport: Dundee is compact and easy to navigate on foot or by bike.

faculties: Faculty of Design, Informatics and Business
Faculty of Social and Applied Sciences

name: University of the Arts London
description: University of the Arts London (UAL) is a world-leading university for art and design. It comprises six renowned colleges: Camberwell College of Arts, Central Saint Martins, Chelsea College of Arts, London College of Communication, London College of Fashion, and Wimbledon College of Arts.
entryRequirements: Entry is highly competitive and usually requires a portfolio. Typical offers range from Distinction to Merit in Foundation Diploma or A-levels.
accommodation: UAL offers a range of halls of residence across London. Priority is given to international students and those with disabilities.
international: UAL is a truly global university, with students from over 130 countries. It offers extensive support for international students, including language support and visa advice.
studentLife: Arts SU runs a wide range of creative societies and campaigns. Being in London offers unparalleled access to galleries, museums, and the creative industries.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. The university looks for creativity, passion, and potential.

travelInfo.train: Major London stations (King's Cross, Waterloo, Paddington, Victoria) connect to all colleges.
travelInfo.bus: Excellent bus network across London. Routes vary by college location.
travelInfo.localTransport: The Tube (Underground) is the best way to get around. Student Oyster cards available.

name: City, University of London
description: City, University of London is a leading global university committed to academic excellence, focused on business and the professions. Located in the heart of London, it has strong links with the City of London and major industries. It is home to the renowned Bayes Business School.
entryRequirements: Entry requirements vary. Bayes Business School courses are highly competitive (AAA-A*AA). Other courses typically require BBB-ABB. Professional experience is valued for postgraduate courses.
accommodation: City offers guaranteed accommodation for all first-year undergraduates. Halls are located within easy travelling distance of the main campus in Northampton Square.
international: City is a truly international university, with students from over 160 countries. It offers a range of support services, including visa advice and an International Student Welcome program.
studentLife: The Students' Union runs a wide range of societies and sports clubs. Being in central London means you have access to world-class culture, entertainment, and nightlife on your doorstep.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. Personal statements should demonstrate a strong interest in the chosen profession. Some courses may require an interview.

travelInfo.train: Angel, Farringdon, and Barbican tube stations are all within walking distance.
travelInfo.bus: Numerous bus routes serve the Islington and Clerkenwell area.
airports: All London airports are easily accessible via public transport.
travelInfo.localTransport: Excellent public transport links make it easy to get around London.

name: Anglia Ruskin University
description:
Anglia Ruskin University (ARU) is an innovative global university with campuses in Cambridge, Chelmsford, and Peterborough. With students from 185 countries, it is one of the most diverse universities in the UK. ARU has been named one of the top 350 institutions in the world in The Times Higher Education World University Rankings 2024 and holds a Gold award in the Teaching Excellence Framework (TEF).

The university is organized into four faculties: Arts, Humanities and Education; Health, Medicine and Social Care; Science and Engineering; and Business and Law. It is known for its strong focus on employability and entrepreneurship.
entryRequirements: Typical offers range from BBC to CCC. ARU is committed to being an inclusive university and considers a wide range of qualifications, including BTECs and Access courses.
accommodation: ARU offers a range of accommodation options in Cambridge, Chelmsford, and Peterborough. Guaranteed accommodation for first-year undergraduates who apply by the deadline. Options range from en-suite rooms to studio apartments.
international: ARU has a vibrant international community with students from over 185 countries. It offers a range of scholarships and support services for international students, including a dedicated International Student Advice Service.
studentLife: The Students' Union supports over 100 societies and sports clubs. Cambridge offers a world-class student experience with a rich history and culture, while Chelmsford offers a modern, lively city environment.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. The university values potential and ambition, and offers a supportive admissions process.

travelInfo.train: Cambridge station is 50 mins from London King's Cross. Chelmsford station is 35 mins from London Liverpool Street.
travelInfo.bus: Both campuses are well-served by local bus networks and Park & Ride services.
airports: Stansted Airport (30 mins from both campuses)
travelInfo.localTransport: Cambridge is famous for cycling. Both cities have excellent public transport.

faculties: Faculty of Arts, Humanities and Education
Faculty of Health, Medicine and Social Care

name: Aston University
description:
Aston University is located in the heart of Birmingham and is known for its focus on business, employability, and entrepreneurship. It was named University of the Year by The Guardian in 2020 and holds a Gold award in the Teaching Excellence Framework (TEF). Aston's campus is a green oasis in the city center, offering a close-knit community feel.

The university is organized into three colleges: Business and Social Sciences, Engineering and Physical Sciences, and Health and Life Sciences. It is particularly famous for its placement year, which is integrated into most undergraduate courses, giving students valuable work experience.
entryRequirements: Typical offers range from BBB to BBC. Aston is known for its placement year, which is integrated into most undergraduate courses. The university accepts a wide range of qualifications including A-levels, BTECs, and IB.
accommodation: Aston Student Village is located on campus and offers over 3,000 en-suite rooms. Accommodation is guaranteed for first-year students. The village creates a safe and friendly community right in the city center.
international: Aston has a very diverse student population, with students from over 120 countries. The university offers extensive support for international students, including visa advice, English language support, and a dedicated international welcome week.
studentLife:
Student life at Aston is vibrant and centered around its city-center campus. The Students' Union (Aston SU) is the hub of activity, running the popular B4 Bar and supporting over 100 clubs and societies. Notable societies include the Aston Economics Society, the Tabletop Gaming Society, and WEST (Women in Engineering, Science, and Technology).

Being in the heart of Birmingham, students have unparalleled access to the city's nightlife. Broad Street, Digbeth, and the Arcadian are all within easy reach, offering a huge variety of clubs, bars, and live music venues. The on-campus Gosta Green pub is a favorite local spot. For sports enthusiasts, the Sir Doug Ellis Woodcock Sports Centre features a 25m swimming pool, gym, and sports halls.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. The university values practical experience and motivation. Interviews may be required for some courses like Medicine and Optometry.

travelInfo.train: Birmingham New Street, Moor Street, and Snow Hill stations are all within a 15-minute walk.
travelInfo.bus: The campus is well-served by local buses connecting to all parts of the city.
travelInfo.localTransport: Birmingham has an extensive transport network, including buses and trams. The city center is walkable.

faculties: College of Business and Social Sciences
College of Engineering and Physical Sciences
College of Health and Life Sciences

name: Arts University Bournemouth
description:
Arts University Bournemouth (AUB) is a leading specialist university dedicated to turning creativity into careers. Established in 1883, it offers a creative community where students collaborate across disciplines. AUB is located on a purpose-built campus in Poole, sharing a border with Bournemouth University, creating a vibrant student hub.

The university focuses on art, design, media, and performance. It is home to the Bournemouth Film School and offers a range of specialist courses from Costume and Performance Design to Modelmaking and Visual Effects.
entryRequirements: Admission is portfolio-based. AUB looks for creativity, skill, and potential. Typical offers range from BBB to BBC at A-level, or Merit/Distinction in Foundation Diploma. Interviews are a key part of the process.
accommodation: AUB offers modern halls of residence on campus and in the town center. Guaranteed accommodation for first-year students who apply by the deadline. The halls provide a great way to meet other creative students.
international: AUB welcomes students from all over the world. It provides a supportive environment with dedicated international student advisors, English language support, and visa advice.
studentLife: The campus is a creative hub with state-of-the-art studios and workshops. Bournemouth offers a vibrant student lifestyle with seven miles of sandy beaches, a lively nightlife, and a thriving arts scene.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. AUB values individuality and creative expression. Portfolios should demonstrate your process as well as final pieces.

travelInfo.train: Bournemouth and Poole stations are accessible by bus. Direct trains to London Waterloo take around 2 hours.
travelInfo.bus: The UNIBUS service connects the campus to Bournemouth and Poole town centers.
travelInfo.localTransport: Cycling is popular, with Beryl Bikes available across the town.

name: Arts University Plymouth
description:
Arts University Plymouth is an independent university-sector art school run by artists and designers for artists and designers. Founded in 1856, it is committed to social justice and creative pedagogy. The university offers a dynamic, cross-disciplinary environment where students can explore their creativity in state-of-the-art studios and workshops.

The university specializes in art, design, media, and performance. It is known for its hands-on approach to learning and its strong links with the creative industries.
entryRequirements: Offers are typically based on a portfolio interview. The university looks for creative potential, passion, and a willingness to experiment. Typical offers range from CCC to BBC.
accommodation: AUP offers a range of accommodation options in the city center, close to the campus and the sea. Guaranteed accommodation for first-year students. Halls are modern and safe.
international: AUP welcomes international students and offers a supportive and inclusive community. It provides assistance with visas, English language support, and settling into UK life.
studentLife: The Students' Union runs a variety of societies and events. Plymouth offers a vibrant cultural scene with galleries, theatres, and music venues, plus easy access to the coast and countryside.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. The university values individuality and a commitment to creative practice. Interviews are a chance to discuss your work and ideas.

travelInfo.train: Plymouth Station is a 15-minute walk away, with direct trains to London Paddington (3h).
travelInfo.bus: Plymouth Coach Station is a short walk away. Local buses serve the city well.
travelInfo.localTransport: Plymouth is a walkable city. Ferries connect to Mount Edgcumbe and France/Spain.

faculties: School of Arts, Media and Creative Industries

name: Bangor University
description:
Bangor University is a historic university located in North Wales, nestled between the Snowdonia mountains and the Menai Strait. Founded in 1884, it offers a unique student experience with a strong focus on sustainability, student satisfaction, and world-leading research. The university is known for its close-knit community and stunning natural surroundings, making it a top choice for students who love the outdoors.

The university is organized into three colleges: Arts, Humanities and Business; Environmental Sciences and Engineering; and Human Sciences. It is particularly renowned for its Ocean Sciences, Psychology, and Welsh language courses.
entryRequirements: Typical offers range from BBB to CCC. The university is committed to widening access and considers a range of qualifications, including the Welsh Baccalaureate. Foundation years are available for many subjects.
accommodation: Bangor offers guaranteed accommodation for first-year students. The Ffriddoedd Village and St Mary's Village offer modern and affordable living options, with gym membership often included. The accommodation is consistently rated among the best in the UK.
international: Bangor welcomes students from all over the world. It offers a friendly and safe environment with dedicated support for international students, including airport pick-up and orientation events.
studentLife: Student life at Bangor is vibrant and community-focused. The Students' Union (Undeb Bangor) offers free membership to all clubs and societies. Popular societies include Langsoc, Zoosoc, and the Hiking Club, taking advantage of the nearby Snowdonia National Park. The Academi is a popular student nightclub, while Bar Uno in Ffriddoedd Village serves as a social hub. The Pontio Arts and Innovation Centre offers cinema, theatre, and dining.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. The university values academic potential and enthusiasm for the subject. They are known for a personal approach to admissions.

travelInfo.train: Bangor Station offers direct trains to London Euston (3.5h), Manchester, and Birmingham.
travelInfo.bus: Local buses connect the university sites and the city. The TrawsCymru network connects to other parts of Wales.
airports: Liverpool John Lennon Airport (1.5h by road)
travelInfo.localTransport: Bangor is compact and walkable. Cycling is popular for getting around the city and exploring the local area.

faculties: College of Arts, Humanities and Business
College of Environmental Sciences and Engineering

name: University of Bath
description:
The University of Bath is known for its excellence in teaching and research, a superb student experience, and outstanding preparation for the workplace. Overlooking the UNESCO World Heritage City of Bath, the campus is safe, friendly, and vibrant. It is particularly renowned for its engineering, physical sciences, mathematics, and technology courses, as well as its world-class sports facilities.

The university is organized into four faculties: Engineering & Design, Humanities & Social Sciences, Science, and the School of Management. It consistently ranks among the top universities in the UK.
entryRequirements: Entry is competitive. Typical offers range from A*AA to AAA. The university looks for students with a strong academic record and a passion for their subject. Many courses require specific A-level subjects, particularly in the sciences and mathematics.
accommodation: Guaranteed accommodation for first-year undergraduates. Options range from city-center complexes to on-campus halls. The 'Quads' and 'Norwood House' are popular on-campus choices, offering a mix of catered and self-catered living.
international: A truly global community with over 30% of students coming from outside the UK. The university offers excellent support for international students, including visa advice, language courses, and a dedicated International Student Association.
studentLife: Student life at Bath is active and diverse. The Students' Union (The SU) runs over 160 societies, including the popular Bath University Student Theatre (BUST) and the Finance Society. The campus has its own nightclub, The Tub, and a pub, The Plug. In the city, students frequent Komedia for comedy and club nights. The Team Bath sports facilities are world-class, hosting Olympic athletes and offering everything from a bobsleigh push-track to a 50m swimming pool.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. Personal statements are important. Some courses may interview. The university also operates a contextual admissions scheme for eligible students.

travelInfo.train: Bath Spa Station is 1h 20m from London Paddington and 15m from Bristol Temple Meads.
travelInfo.bus: The U1 and U2 buses run frequently (24/7 in term time) between the city center and the campus.
travelInfo.localTransport: Excellent bus links. The campus is on a hill ('The Hill'), so the bus is the preferred mode of transport for many, though cycling is encouraged with e-bike schemes.

name: Bath Spa University
description:
Bath Spa University is a leading university for creativity, culture, and enterprise. Its main campus, Newton Park, is set in a stunning historic parkland designed by Capability Brown, featuring a castle and a lake. The university focuses on liberal arts, humanities, and creative industries, offering a supportive and inspiring environment for students.

The university is comprised of several schools, including the Bath School of Art, Film and Media, and the School of Music and Performing Arts. It is known for its small class sizes and personalized teaching.
entryRequirements: Typical offers range from BBC to CCC. The university looks for creative potential and enthusiasm, often asking for portfolios or auditions for creative courses. They are very inclusive and consider a wide range of qualifications.
accommodation: Bath Spa offers a range of accommodation options on campus (Newton Park) and in the city (Green Park House). Guaranteed accommodation for first-year students. The lakeside accommodation at Newton Park is particularly scenic.
international: Bath Spa welcomes students from over 80 countries. It offers a friendly and supportive environment with dedicated international support, including English language preparation courses.
studentLife: The Students' Union supports a wide range of societies and clubs, such as the Creative Writing Society and the Wildlife and Conservation Society. The SU Bar at Newton Park is a central social hub. In the city, students enjoy venues like Moles for live music. The university's strong links with local festivals (like the Bath Festival) provide great opportunities for students.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. The university values creativity and individuality. Interviews and portfolio reviews are common for arts subjects.

travelInfo.train: Bath Spa Station connects to London and Bristol.
travelInfo.bus: The U5 bus connects the Newton Park campus, the city center, and other sites.
travelInfo.localTransport: The university runs a dedicated bus service. Cycling along the Bristol-Bath cycle path is also popular.

faculties: Bath School of Art, Film and Media
School of Music and Performing Arts
School of Writing, Publishing and the Humanities

name: Goldsmiths, University of London
description: Goldsmiths is a world-renowned university specialising in the arts, humanities, social sciences, and computing. Located in New Cross, South East London, it is known for its creativity, radical thinking, and vibrant student community.
entryRequirements: Typical offers range from BBB to ABB. Portfolios or auditions are often required for creative courses. The university values creativity and independent thought.
accommodation: Goldsmiths offers several halls of residence near the campus. Guaranteed accommodation for international students. Options range from shared flats to studio apartments.
international: Goldsmiths has a diverse international community with students from over 135 countries. It offers a range of support services, including immigration advice and English language support.
studentLife: The Students' Union is active and politically engaged. New Cross is a hub for music and art, with a thriving nightlife and cultural scene.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. The university looks for passion, creativity, and critical thinking.

travelInfo.train: New Cross and New Cross Gate stations (Overground/Rail) are a 5-minute walk. London Bridge is 10 mins away.
travelInfo.bus: Excellent bus links to Central London and South East London.
travelInfo.localTransport: New Cross is well-connected. Cycling is popular, and Central London is easily accessible.

faculties: School of Media, Communications and Cultural Studies
School of Professional Studies, Science and Technology

name: University of Greenwich
description: The University of Greenwich boasts three magnificent campuses in London and Kent, including the UNESCO World Heritage Site at Greenwich. It combines historic grandeur with modern teaching facilities and a diverse international community.
entryRequirements: Typical offers range from BBC to BCC at A-level. The university offers many foundation year courses for those who do not meet the standard entry requirements.
accommodation: Accommodation is available at Greenwich and Avery Hill campuses. The Cutty Sark Hall in Greenwich offers modern ensuite rooms. Avery Hill Student Village provides a campus community feel.
international: Greenwich has a diverse international community with students from over 140 countries. The university offers a dedicated International Student Support team.
studentLife: The Students' Union runs a variety of sports clubs and societies. The Greenwich campus is located in a UNESCO World Heritage Site, offering stunning views and easy access to London's attractions.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. The university considers a wide range of qualifications and experience.

travelInfo.train: Greenwich station (DLR and National Rail) is 8 mins walk. Maze Hill is also nearby.
travelInfo.bus: Served by many routes (129, 177, 188, 199, etc.). Free inter-campus bus.
airports: London City Airport (20 mins via DLR)
travelInfo.localTransport: Thames Clippers boat service offers a scenic route to campus.

faculties: Faculty of Liberal Arts and Sciences
Faculty of Education, Health & Human Sciences

name: Harper Adams University
description: Harper Adams University is the leading specialist university for tackling the future development of our planet's food production, processing, animal sciences, engineering, land management and sustainable business. Set on a 635-hectare farm campus in Shropshire.
entryRequirements: Entry requirements typically include A-levels in science subjects. A rural background is not essential. The university values practical experience and enthusiasm for the subject area.
accommodation: On-campus accommodation is guaranteed for first-year undergraduates. There is a range of catered and self-catered halls, all located within easy walking distance of lecture theatres and facilities.
international: Harper Adams attracts students from all over the world interested in agriculture and land-based studies. The university offers support with visas and English language.
studentLife: The Students' Union (HASU) is central to social life, organizing events like the freshers' ball and seasonal balls. There are numerous sports clubs, including rugby, shooting, and rowing.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. Interviews may be required for some courses.

travelInfo.train: Stafford, Telford, and Shrewsbury are the nearest stations. Regular buses connect to campus.
travelInfo.bus: Dedicated university shuttle bus to Newport. Public buses 519 and 103 serve the campus.
travelInfo.localTransport: Rural campus. Shuttle bus and car sharing are popular.

name: University of Hertfordshire
description: The University of Hertfordshire is one of the UK's leading business-facing universities. It offers excellent teaching, state-of-the-art facilities, and strong links with industry, all within easy reach of London.
entryRequirements: Typical offers range from BBC to CCC. The university is known for its flexible entry requirements and consideration of vocational qualifications.
accommodation: The university offers a wide range of on-campus accommodation at both College Lane and de Havilland campuses. Options range from twin rooms to studio flats.
international: Hertfordshire is a popular choice for international students, with a large and vibrant international community. The university offers English language support and orientation programs.
studentLife: The Forum Hertfordshire is a major entertainment venue on campus, hosting club nights and live music. The Students' Union runs a wide range of societies and sports clubs.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. The university is committed to widening participation.

travelInfo.train: Hatfield station (25 mins to King's Cross) is nearby. Uno buses connect station to campus.
travelInfo.bus: Uno bus network (university-owned) provides extensive links. Free inter-campus shuttle.
travelInfo.localTransport: Excellent bus network (Uno). Close proximity to A1(M).

faculties: School of Health, Medicine and Life Sciences
School of Physics, Engineering and Computer Science

name: Birkbeck, University of London
description:
Birkbeck, University of London is a world-class research and teaching institution, uniquely providing evening higher education. This model allows students to balance study with work, internships, or other commitments. Located in Bloomsbury, the academic heart of London, Birkbeck is part of the prestigious University of London.

The university is organized into five schools, including Arts, Business, Law, Science, and Social Sciences. It attracts a diverse range of students, from school leavers to working professionals, creating a mature and stimulating learning environment.
entryRequirements: Birkbeck considers a wide range of qualifications and professional experience. Typical offers range from BBC to CCC. They are particularly welcoming to mature students and those with non-traditional backgrounds.
accommodation: Birkbeck students have access to University of London intercollegiate halls (like Garden Halls and International Hall) and other private accommodation options in London. The university also offers advice on finding private rentals.
international: Birkbeck welcomes students from over 120 countries. Its evening study model is popular with international students who want to work during the day (subject to visa regulations). The university provides dedicated international student support.
studentLife: Student life at Birkbeck is unique. The George Birkbeck Bar is a popular spot for students to socialize before or after classes. The Students' Union supports various societies, including the Birkbeck Law Society and the Film Society. Being in Bloomsbury, students have access to the British Museum, Senate House Library, and the vibrant culture of central London.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. The university values motivation and life experience. Personal statements should explain why the evening study model suits you.

travelInfo.train: Euston, King's Cross, and St Pancras International are all within walking distance.
travelInfo.bus: Excellent bus links serve the Bloomsbury area day and night.
airports: All London airports are easily accessible via public transport (Heathrow, Gatwick, Stansted, Luton, City).
travelInfo.localTransport: The Tube (Russell Square, Goodge Street, Tottenham Court Road) makes getting around London easy.

faculties: School of Business, Economics and Informatics
School of Social Sciences, History and Philosophy

name: Birmingham City University
description:
Birmingham City University (BCU) is a dynamic and diverse university located in the heart of Birmingham. It focuses on practice-based learning and has strong links with industry and the professions. The university has invested heavily in its facilities, including the state-of-the-art City Centre Campus and the Royal Birmingham Conservatoire.

The university is organized into four faculties: Arts, Design and Media; Business, Law and Social Sciences; Health, Education and Life Sciences; and Computing, Engineering and the Built Environment.
entryRequirements: Typical offers range from BBC to CCC. The university considers a wide range of qualifications and experience, including BTECs. Portfolios or auditions are often required for arts and music courses.
accommodation: BCU offers a range of accommodation options in the city center, such as University Locks and Jennens Court. Guaranteed accommodation for first-year students who apply by the deadline. All halls are close to the campuses.
international: BCU welcomes students from over 100 countries. It offers a range of scholarships and support services for international students, including a dedicated International Office and visa support.
studentLife: The Students' Union (BCUSU) supports over 100 societies and sports clubs, including the Gaming Society and Music Society. The Eagle & Ball is the SU's own Victorian pub on campus. Birmingham offers a vibrant nightlife with venues like Snobs and PRYZM, plus great shopping at the Bullring.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. The university looks for potential and a passion for the subject. They value practical skills and creativity.

travelInfo.train: New Street and Moor Street stations are a short walk from the City Centre Campus.
travelInfo.bus: The city is well-connected by bus. The campus is near the future HS2 station.
travelInfo.localTransport: Birmingham is well-connected by bus and tram. The City Centre Campus is walkable from the main stations.

faculties: Faculty of Arts, Design and Media
Faculty of Business, Law and Social Sciences
Faculty of Health, Education and Life Sciences
Faculty of Computing, Engineering and the Built Environment

name: University of Bedfordshire
description: The University of Bedfordshire is a modern, innovative university with a heritage of top-quality education going back more than 100 years. With main campuses in Luton and Bedford, and satellite campuses in Milton Keynes and Aylesbury, it offers a supportive and diverse learning environment. The university is known for its practical approach to learning, excellent facilities, and strong industry links. The Luton campus has recently undergone a 46m STEM building upgrade and a 40m library refurbishment, while the Bedford campus is home to a dedicated Physical Education and Sports Science Centre.
entryRequirements: The University of Bedfordshire is committed to widening participation and considers a broad range of qualifications. Typical offers range from 80-112 UCAS points (CDD to BBC at A-Level). The university also offers Foundation Years for many degrees, making higher education accessible to those who may not meet standard entry requirements. BTEC Extended Diplomas and Access to HE Diplomas are widely accepted.
accommodation: The university offers modern, safe, and secure accommodation at both the Luton and Bedford campuses. The Student Village in Luton offers en-suite rooms and studio apartments right next to the campus. In Bedford, Polhill Park offers similar high-quality living. All first-year students are guaranteed a room if they apply by the deadline. Rent is competitively priced and includes all bills, Wi-Fi, and insurance.
international: Bedfordshire has a thriving international community with students from over 120 countries. The International Office provides dedicated support for visa applications, airport pick-ups, and a comprehensive induction programme. The university offers pre-sessional English courses for students who need to improve their language skills before starting their degree. Scholarships are available for high-achieving international students.
studentLife: The Students' Union (Beds SU) is at the heart of student life, running a wide range of societies and sports clubs, from football and dance to anime and debating. The Metro Bar in Luton and The Hub in Bedford are popular social spaces hosting regular events, quizzes, and live music. Luton offers a diverse mix of culture and entertainment, while Bedford is a riverside town with great parks and festivals.
admissions: Applications for full-time undergraduate courses are made via UCAS. The university has a flexible admissions policy and looks at more than just grades; personal statements and references are key. Interviews or portfolios may be required for courses in Art, Design, Performing Arts, and Health. The university also operates a direct application route for some courses.

travelInfo.train: Luton campus is a 10-minute walk from Luton station (22 mins to London St Pancras). Bedford campus is a short bus ride from Bedford station (40 mins to London).
travelInfo.bus: The university operates a free shuttle bus for students and staff between the Luton and Bedford campuses. Local bus networks are extensive.
airports: London Luton Airport (10 mins by bus)
travelInfo.localTransport: Both Luton and Bedford are compact and walkable. The free inter-campus shuttle is a major benefit for students.

faculties: Faculty of Creative Arts, Technologies and Science
Faculty of Health and Social Sciences

name: University of Birmingham
description: The University of Birmingham is a founding member of the prestigious Russell Group and the first civic university in England, established in 1900. Its stunning 276-acre green campus is located in Edgbaston, just minutes from the city center. Dominated by the iconic 'Old Joe' clock tower (the tallest freestanding clock tower in the world), the university is a global top 100 institution known for its research impact, graduate employability, and world-class facilities, including a new state-of-the-art library and sports center.
entryRequirements: Admission to Birmingham is competitive. Typical A-level offers range from A*AA to ABB, depending on the course. The university operates a 'Skill4Uni' programme and offers contextual admissions to support students from underrepresented backgrounds. International Baccalaureate offers typically range from 32 to 32 points. Specific subject requirements apply for Science, Engineering, and Medicine courses.
accommodation: The university provides over 7,000 rooms across three main student villages: The Vale Village (lakeside parkland setting), Selly Oak Village (closest to campus), and Pritchatts Park Village. Options range from catered halls with meal plans to self-catered en-suite flats and studios. Accommodation is guaranteed for all first-year undergraduates who apply by the deadline.
international: Birmingham is a truly global university with a diverse community of over 10,000 international students from 150 countries. The university has a dedicated International Student Team offering visa advice, welcome events, and ongoing support. The Dubai campus also offers opportunities for study abroad. Pre-sessional English courses are available.
studentLife: The Guild of Students is the hub of student life, supporting over 250 student groups, societies, and volunteering projects. The campus boasts world-class sports facilities, including a 50m swimming pool and a gym. The university has its own train station ('University'), making it incredibly easy (7 mins) to get into Birmingham city center for its famous nightlife, Bullring shopping, and cultural events.
admissions: Applications are made through UCAS. The university values a well-rounded personal statement that demonstrates passion for the subject. Some courses, such as Medicine, Dentistry, and Education, require interviews. The university also accepts a wide range of international qualifications.

travelInfo.train: The only UK university with its own dedicated train station ('University'). Trains run every 10 mins to Birmingham New Street (7 min journey).
travelInfo.bus: Frequent bus services (e.g., X20, X21, X22) connect the campus to the city center and student residential areas like Selly Oak and Harborne.
travelInfo.localTransport: The campus is very walkable and cycle-friendly. A canal towpath offers a scenic cycle route into the city center.

faculties: College of Engineering and Physical Sciences
College of Life and Environmental Sciences
College of Medical and Dental Sciences

name: University of Bolton
description: The University of Bolton is a modern, compact university with a strong focus on teaching quality and student satisfaction. Located in a friendly town in Greater Manchester, it offers a personalized learning experience with small class sizes and excellent facilities. The university is particularly renowned for its Special Effects for Film and TV courses, as well as its Engineering and Nursing programs. The campus has seen significant investment, including the 31m Bolton One health, leisure, and research centre.
entryRequirements: The University of Bolton is committed to being an inclusive institution. Typical offers range from 96-112 UCAS points (CCC to BBC at A-Level). The university values vocational qualifications and experience, making it a great choice for mature students. Foundation years are available for many courses.
accommodation: Orlando Village is the university's recommended accommodation provider, located just a 10-minute walk from the campus. It offers 380 single study bedrooms with shared kitchens and bathrooms. The accommodation is affordable and includes all utility bills and internet. It provides a safe and friendly community for first-year students.
international: Bolton welcomes students from all over the world and has a diverse campus community. The International Team provides support with visas, finance, and settling into UK life. The university offers a range of international scholarships and has a dedicated International Society that organizes trips and social events.
studentLife: The Students' Union runs a variety of societies and sports clubs, from the Afro-Caribbean Society to the Tabletop Gaming Society. Bolton town center is just a short walk away, offering shops, cinemas, and restaurants. For big city nightlife and culture, Manchester is just a 20-minute train ride away.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. The university takes a holistic view of applications, considering personal statements and references alongside grades. Interviews or portfolios may be required for creative courses like Art, Design, and Special Effects.

travelInfo.train: Bolton Interchange is a 10-minute walk from campus. Trains to Manchester Victoria take just 20 minutes.
travelInfo.bus: The Interchange is also a hub for local bus services, connecting the university to the wider Greater Manchester area.
travelInfo.localTransport: Bolton is a compact town and the campus is easily walkable. Excellent links to Manchester make commuting easy.

name: Bournemouth University
description: Bournemouth University (BU) is a forward-thinking institution renowned globally for its excellence in media, animation, and communication. Located on the stunning south coast of England, BU combines academic excellence with real-world experience. It is home to the National Centre for Computer Animation (NCCA), whose graduates have worked on Oscar-winning films. The university has two main campuses: Talbot (academic hub) and Lansdowne (accommodation and admin), both close to the town's famous seven-mile sandy beach.
entryRequirements: BU looks for motivated students with a passion for their subject. Typical A-level offers range from ABB to BBC. The university is particularly famous for its animation and media courses, which may require a portfolio. BTEC Extended Diplomas (DDM-DMM) are widely accepted.
accommodation: BU offers a wide range of accommodation, primarily located in the Lansdowne area (close to town and beach) and the Student Village on Talbot Campus. Options include en-suite rooms in halls, studios, and Unilet shared houses. All first-year students are guaranteed accommodation if they book by the deadline.
international: BU is a popular choice for international students, with a community representing over 120 countries. The university offers generous scholarships, including the Academic Excellence Scholarship. Dedicated support includes airport transfers, orientation programmes, and English language support.
studentLife: Bournemouth offers an incredible student lifestyle with seven miles of golden beaches, a vibrant nightlife scene, and plenty of water sports. The Students' Union (SUBU) is award-winning and runs the 'Old Fire Station' nightclub. There are over 100 clubs and societies to join.
admissions: Applications are via UCAS. For creative courses, your portfolio is as important as your grades. The university values relevant work experience and a strong personal statement.

travelInfo.train: Bournemouth station is a major hub. 1h 45m to London Waterloo. 35 mins to Southampton.
travelInfo.bus: The 'Unibus' service provides frequent, reliable links between campuses, accommodation, and the town center.
travelInfo.localTransport: Cycling is popular along the promenade. The town has excellent bus links.

faculties: Faculty of Health and Social Sciences

name: University of Brighton
description: The University of Brighton is a vibrant, creative, and inclusive community located in one of the UK's most diverse and livable cities. With a focus on practice-based learning, the university empowers students to make a positive difference in the world. It is particularly strong in Art, Design, and Sport. The university is spread across campuses in Brighton (City, Moulsecoomb, Falmer) and Eastbourne, each offering specialist facilities and a unique atmosphere.
entryRequirements: The university considers a wide range of qualifications. Typical A-level offers range from BBB to CCC. Portfolios are essential for Art and Design courses. The university is known for its flexible and inclusive admissions policy, valuing creativity and potential.
accommodation: The university manages over 2,000 halls of residence places in Brighton and Eastbourne. Options range from the new Moulsecoomb Place to the seafront Phoenix Brewery halls. The university also assists students in finding private rented accommodation through its 'Student Homes' scheme.
international: Brighton attracts students from over 150 countries. The university offers international scholarships, free airport pickup, and a comprehensive orientation programme. The International College provides pathway courses for students who need extra preparation.
studentLife: Brighton is famous for its independent shops, music venues, and festivals (like Brighton Pride and The Great Escape). The Students' Union (BSU) runs over 100 societies. The university has excellent sports facilities, and the beach is perfect for swimming, paddleboarding, or just relaxing.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. For creative courses, interviews and portfolio reviews are common. The university looks for students who are curious, creative, and committed to their subject.

travelInfo.train: Brighton station is 1 hour from London Victoria/London Bridge. Moulsecoomb and Falmer campuses have their own train stations.
travelInfo.bus: Brighton & Hove Buses offer excellent service across the city. Students get discounted travel.
travelInfo.localTransport: Brighton is very walkable and cycle-friendly. The 'BTN BikeShare' scheme is popular.

faculties: School of Humanities and Social Science
School of Sport and Health Sciences
School of Architecture, Technology and Engineering

name: University of Bristol
description: The University of Bristol is a red brick research university located in Bristol, England. It is a member of the prestigious Russell Group and is consistently ranked among the top universities in the UK and the world. Known for its research excellence and vibrant student life, it attracts students from all over the globe. The university's precinct is woven into the fabric of the city, with the iconic Wills Memorial Building dominating the skyline. It has a reputation for innovation, being the first university in the UK to admit men and women on an equal footing.
entryRequirements: Entry requirements are high, reflecting the university's academic reputation. Typical A-level offers range from A*A*A to ABB. The university is committed to widening participation and offers contextual offers (up to two grades lower) for eligible students. Admissions tests like the UCAT (Medicine) and LNAT (Law) are required for specific courses.
accommodation: Bristol offers a wide range of accommodation options, from the vibrant Student Village in Stoke Bishop (a short bus ride from campus) to city-centre residences like the new Metal Works. Options include catered and self-catered halls, with guaranteed accommodation for all new first-year undergraduates who apply by the deadline. The 'East' and 'West' villages offer distinct communities.
international: Bristol is a truly global university with students from over 150 countries. The university offers dedicated support for international students, including visa advice, welcome events, and English language support. The Global Lounge is a cultural hub for all students, hosting regular events and celebrations.
studentLife: Student life at Bristol is exciting and diverse. The Students' Union (Bristol SU) supports over 350 societies and sports clubs, from the Cheese Society to the Hot Air Ballooning Society. The city itself is famous for its creativity, music scene (birthplace of trip-hop), and independent spirit, offering endless opportunities for entertainment and culture.
admissions: Applications for full-time undergraduate courses are made through UCAS. The university looks for students with the potential to succeed, considering personal statements and references alongside academic grades. Interviews may be required for some courses like Medicine and Dentistry.

travelInfo.train: Bristol Temple Meads is the main station, 1h 40m from London Paddington. The number 8 bus connects the station to the Clifton campus.
travelInfo.bus: The number 8 bus runs frequently from Temple Meads to the University and Clifton. Bristol Bus Station handles national coaches.
airports: Bristol Airport (30 mins by Bristol Flyer bus)
travelInfo.localTransport: Bristol is a cycling city with many dedicated lanes. Walking is popular, though the city is hilly! Voi e-scooters are widely used.

faculties: Faculty of Social Sciences and Law

name: Oxford Brookes University
description: Oxford Brookes University is a modern, forward-thinking institution with a strong reputation for teaching excellence and industry connections. Located in the historic student city of Oxford, it offers a distinct alternative with a focus on practical skills and employability.

travelInfo.train: Oxford Station (10 min bus/taxi). Oxford Parkway (20 min bus). Direct trains to London Paddington (1h).
travelInfo.bus: BrookesBus (U1/U5/400) connects all campuses and city. Oxford Tube runs 24/7 to London.
airports: Heathrow Airport (80 mins by Airline coach)
travelInfo.localTransport: Excellent bus network. Cycling is very popular (Oxford is a 'cycling city').

entryRequirements: Typical offers range from BBB to CCC. The university values potential and considers a wide range of qualifications.
accommodation: Guaranteed accommodation for first-year students in a range of halls in Headington, Harcourt Hill, and Wheatley.
international: A diverse community with students from over 140 countries. Dedicated support team for international students.
studentLife: The Students' Union runs over 100 societies. Oxford offers a rich cultural experience with museums, theatres, and historic pubs.
admissions: Apply via UCAS.
faculties: School of Biological and Medical Sciences
School of Education, Humanities and Languages
School of Engineering, Computing and Mathematics

name: Brunel University London
description: Brunel University London is a campus-based university situated in Uxbridge, West London. Named after the Victorian engineer Isambard Kingdom Brunel, it has a strong tradition of engineering, design, and technology. The university is known for its sandwich courses and strong industry connections, ensuring graduates are work-ready. The campus is a self-contained community with everything students need on site.
entryRequirements: Entry requirements vary by course but typically range from BBB to AAA at A-level. The university values practical skills and may ask for a portfolio for design courses. Foundation years are available for Engineering and other subjects.
accommodation: Brunel offers a wide range of on-campus accommodation, with over 4,500 rooms available. All first-year students are guaranteed a room on campus. Options range from standard rooms to en-suite studios. The 'Urban' halls are popular for their modern design.
international: Brunel has a vibrant international community with students from over 130 countries. The university offers dedicated support for international students, including English language courses (Brunel Language Centre) and visa advice. The International Student Ambassador scheme helps new students settle in.
studentLife: The campus has everything you need, including bars (The Academy), a nightclub, and a variety of food outlets. The Union of Brunel Students runs over 100 societies and sports clubs. Being in Uxbridge, students have easy access to central London via the Tube, while enjoying a safer, greener campus environment.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. Brunel is known for its flexible admissions policy and considers a wide range of qualifications. Personal statements should highlight relevant skills and motivation.

travelInfo.train: Uxbridge tube station (Metropolitan and Piccadilly lines) is a short bus ride or 20-minute walk away. West Drayton station (Elizabeth Line) is also nearby.
travelInfo.bus: Regular buses (U1, U2, U3, U4, U7) connect the campus to Uxbridge, West Drayton, and Heathrow Airport.
travelInfo.localTransport: The campus is well-connected to central London by tube. Night buses run from London to Uxbridge.

College of Engineering, Design and Physical Sciences
College of Health, Medicine and Life Sciences

name: University of Buckingham
description: The University of Buckingham is the UK's only independent university with a Royal Charter, and one of the few to offer two-year undergraduate degrees. This unique model allows students to enter the workforce a year earlier than their peers. Located in a picturesque market town, the university offers small class sizes and a personalized learning environment, consistently ranking high for student satisfaction.
entryRequirements: Typical offers range from BBB to CCC at A-level. The university takes a holistic approach to admissions, valuing motivation and potential as much as grades. The two-year degree structure is intensive, so commitment is key.
accommodation: Buckingham offers guaranteed accommodation for first-year students on its Hunter Street and Verney Park campuses. Options include en-suite rooms and shared flats. The accommodation is safe, comfortable, and close to lecture halls.
international: Buckingham is a truly international community, with students from over 100 countries. The university offers a friendly and supportive environment, with dedicated staff to help with visas, banking, and healthcare. The small campus size makes it easy to make friends.
studentLife: The Students' Union runs over 30 societies and sports clubs, from the Law Society to the Debating Society. The university is located in a historic market town with plenty of cafes, pubs, and shops. For a bigger night out, Milton Keynes and Oxford are just a short bus or car ride away.
admissions: Apply via UCAS or directly to the university. The direct application route is free and offers a quick decision. Interviews are common, allowing applicants to demonstrate their passion for the subject.

travelInfo.train: The nearest stations are Milton Keynes Central (30 mins by bus) and Bicester North.
travelInfo.bus: The X5 bus connects Buckingham to Oxford, Milton Keynes, and Cambridge.
travelInfo.localTransport: Buckingham is a small, walkable town. Most students walk or cycle to campus.

faculties: School of Humanities and Social Sciences

name: Canterbury Christ Church University
description: Canterbury Christ Church University (CCCU) is a modern, friendly university with a strong heritage in teacher training, health, and public services. Located in the historic cathedral city of Canterbury (a UNESCO World Heritage Site), it offers a safe and inspiring place to study. The university has invested millions in new facilities, including a 65m STEM building and a creative arts center.
entryRequirements: Typical offers range from BBC to CCC at A-level. The university is committed to widening participation and considers a broad range of qualifications, including BTECs and Access courses. Foundation years are available for many subjects.
accommodation: CCCU offers a range of accommodation options in the city center and at the North Holmes campus. Petros Court and St George's Centre are popular modern halls. Guaranteed accommodation for first-year students who apply by the deadline.
international: The university welcomes students from over 80 countries. It offers a friendly and supportive environment with dedicated international support, including airport pick-ups and orientation events. The historic city is a major draw for international students.
studentLife: The Students' Union runs a variety of societies and sports clubs, from the Harry Potter Society to American Football. Canterbury is a beautiful and safe city with a vibrant cultural scene, including the Marlowe Theatre and numerous festivals. It has a high student population and plenty of student-friendly bars and cafes.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. The university values potential and a commitment to making a difference. Interviews are required for teaching, health, and social work courses.

travelInfo.train: Canterbury West (High Speed to London St Pancras in 55 mins) and Canterbury East are both within walking distance.
travelInfo.bus: The 'UniBus' connects the campus to the city center and student accommodation.
travelInfo.localTransport: Canterbury is a compact, walkable city. Cycling is also very popular.

faculties: Faculty of Arts, Humanities and Education
Faculty of Medicine, Health and Social Care
Faculty of Science, Engineering and Social Sciences

name: Cardiff University
description: Cardiff University is a prestigious Russell Group university located in the vibrant capital of Wales. Founded in 1883, it is known for its world-leading research, high student satisfaction, and beautiful civic center campus. The university combines historic buildings with modern facilities, including the Centre for Student Life. It offers an exceptional student experience in a friendly, affordable, and culturally rich city.
entryRequirements: Cardiff welcomes students with a wide range of qualifications. Typical A-level offers range from AAA to BBB. The university is committed to fair access and offers a contextual admissions scheme. The Welsh Baccalaureate is highly valued and can be included in offers.
accommodation: Cardiff offers a guarantee of accommodation for most first-year undergraduates. Options range from the popular Talybont halls (great for sports) to the city-center Senghennydd Court. Prices are generally lower than the UK average, making it an affordable place to live.
international: Cardiff has a diverse community with students from over 130 countries. The university offers a free airport collection service from Cardiff and Heathrow airports. The International Student Support team provides dedicated advice, social events, and a global lounge.
studentLife: Cardiff Students' Union is consistently ranked as one of the best in the UK, with its own nightclub (Y Plas) and pub (The Taf). The city is famous for its friendly atmosphere, rugby culture, and proximity to beautiful beaches and mountains. It has a thriving music and arts scene.
admissions: Applications are via UCAS. The university looks for potential and passion for the subject. Interviews are required for some healthcare and education courses. Cardiff is known for its supportive admissions team and clear communication.

travelInfo.train: Cardiff Central is a major hub. 2h from London Paddington. Cathays station is right on the main campus.
travelInfo.bus: Excellent local bus network. Most students walk or cycle as the city is compact and flat.
travelInfo.localTransport: Cardiff is one of the flattest cities in the UK, making it perfect for cycling. Nextbike scheme is widely used.

faculties: College of Arts, Humanities and Social Sciences
College of Biomedical and Life Sciences
College of Physical Sciences and Engineering

name: Cardiff Metropolitan University
description: Cardiff Metropolitan University is a career-focused university with a strong reputation for sport, art, and design. It is located in the vibrant capital city of Wales, with two campuses: Llandaff and Cyncoed. The university is known for its high graduate employability and practical, industry-led courses. It has been named UK and Ireland University of the Year 2021 by the Times Higher Education.
entryRequirements: Typical offers range from BBB to CCC at A-level. The university considers a wide range of qualifications, including BTECs and the Welsh Baccalaureate. It values practical experience and portfolios for creative courses.
accommodation: Cardiff Met offers a range of accommodation options at the Cyncoed and Plas Gwyn campuses. Guaranteed accommodation for first-year students who apply by the deadline. The halls are modern, safe, and foster a strong community spirit.
international: Cardiff Met welcomes students from over 140 countries. It offers a range of scholarships and support services for international students, including airport pick-ups and social events. The university has a global outlook and partnerships worldwide.
studentLife: The Students' Union runs over 50 societies and sports clubs, with a particular strength in team sports. Cardiff is a friendly and affordable city with a great nightlife, shopping, and green spaces. The Met Rider bus service connects campuses and the city center.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. The university values potential and a commitment to professional development. Interviews or portfolios may be required for Art, Design, and Sport courses.

travelInfo.train: Cardiff Central and Waun-gron Park are the nearest stations.
travelInfo.bus: The dedicated 'Met Rider' bus service connects all campuses and halls with the city center.
travelInfo.localTransport: Cardiff is easy to get around by bus, bike, or on foot.

faculties: Cardiff School of Art and Design
Cardiff School of Sport and Health Sciences
Cardiff School of Education and Social Policy

name: University of Exeter
description: The University of Exeter is a Russell Group university that combines world-class research with high levels of student satisfaction. Its Streatham Campus is widely considered one of the most beautiful in the UK, featuring botanical gardens and stunning views. It offers a perfect blend of academic rigor and a high quality of life in the South West.
entryRequirements: A-level offers typically range from A*AA to BBB. The university values a well-rounded profile. Contextual offers are available for eligible students.
accommodation: A variety of halls are available, both catered and self-catered. 'Holland Hall' is known for its views, while 'Birks Grange' is a popular self-catered option.
international: Exeter has a diverse international community and offers the 'Into Exeter' program for pathway students. The city is welcoming and safe.
studentLife: Exeter offers a vibrant student life with a focus on outdoor activities, sports, and a buzzing city center. The 'Ram' bar on campus is a legendary student haunt.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. The university looks for potential to succeed and contribute to the community.

travelInfo.train: Exeter St Davids is the main station, 2h 30m from London Paddington. The D bus connects the station to campus.
travelInfo.bus: The D bus runs frequently from the city center and St Davids station to Streatham Campus.
travelInfo.localTransport: The city is walkable, but the campus is hilly. The D bus is essential for many.

Faculty of Humanities, Arts and Social Sciences

name: University of Manchester
description: The University of Manchester is a prestigious Russell Group university with a rich heritage of innovation and social responsibility. As one of the UK's largest single-site universities, it offers world-class education and research in a vibrant, multicultural city.

travelInfo.train: Manchester Piccadilly (20 min walk, 147 bus). Oxford Road (10 min walk). Direct to London (2h).
travelInfo.bus: Free 147 Bus for students connects stations and campus. Magic Bus (142/143) to Fallowfield.
airports: Manchester Airport (20 mins by direct train)
travelInfo.localTransport: Excellent tram (Metrolink) and bus network. Very walkable campus/city.

entryRequirements: Typical offers range from A*A*A to ABB. The university seeks students with academic potential and a commitment to learning.
accommodation: One of the largest ranges of accommodation in the UK, with options in Fallowfield, Victoria Park, and City locations. Guaranteed for first-years.
international: A massive global community with over 10,000 international students from 160 countries. Extensive support services available.
studentLife: The Students' Union is one of the largest in the UK.  Facilities include the Manchester Aquatics Centre and Sugden Sports Centre.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. Competition is high for popular courses.
faculties: Faculty of Biology, Medicine and Health

name: Coventry University
description: Coventry University is a forward-looking, modern university with a proud tradition of high-quality education and applied research. Located in the UK's City of Culture 2021, it is known for its excellent industry links, particularly in automotive design and engineering. The university has a strong focus on student employability and offers a truly global experience with opportunities for international travel.
entryRequirements: Typical offers range from BBB to CCC at A-level. Coventry is known for its flexible and inclusive admissions policy, considering a wide range of qualifications including BTECs. Portfolios are required for art and design courses.
accommodation: Coventry offers a wide range of modern student accommodation in the city center, much of it built recently. Options range from catered halls to private studios. The university's 'FutureLets' service helps students find safe and affordable housing.
international: Coventry is one of the most international universities in the UK, welcoming students from over 150 countries. It has a dedicated International Student Hub and offers extensive support, including English language classes and visa advice.
studentLife: The Coventry University Students' Union (CUSU) is a hub of activity with over 130 societies. The city itself is diverse and student-friendly, with plenty of cafes, bars, and cultural venues. It is also just 20 minutes from Birmingham.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. The university looks for motivation and potential. Interviews are required for some health and nursing courses.

travelInfo.train: Coventry Station is a major hub. 1h to London Euston, 20 mins to Birmingham New Street.
travelInfo.bus: Pool Meadow Bus Station serves local and national routes. The campus is in the city center.
travelInfo.localTransport: Compact city center campus, easily walkable. Good bus links to surrounding areas.

faculties: College of the Arts and Society
College of Engineering, Environment and Science

name: Cranfield University
description: Cranfield University is a specialist postgraduate university that is a global leader for education and transformational research in technology and management. It is the only university in Europe with its own airport and aircraft. Cranfield has a strong focus on industry partnerships and solving real-world problems.
entryRequirements: As a postgraduate university, entry requirements typically include a First or Second Class Honours degree or equivalent. Relevant work experience is also highly valued. English language requirements apply for international students.
accommodation: Cranfield offers a range of accommodation options on its rural campus, from halls of residence to family houses. Living on campus provides a convenient and community-focused experience.
international: Cranfield is a truly global community, with over half of its students coming from outside the UK. The university offers extensive support for international students, including visa advice and English language support.
studentLife: Student life at Cranfield is diverse and professional. The Cranfield Students' Association (CSA) runs various clubs and societies. The campus has its own bars, cafes, and sports facilities. The location offers a quiet environment for study, with easy access to Milton Keynes and Bedford.
admissions: Apply directly to the university via the website. There is no UCAS application for postgraduate courses. Early application is recommended.

travelInfo.train: Milton Keynes Central (30 mins) and Bedford (20 mins) are the nearest major stations.
travelInfo.bus: The 'Cranfield Connect' bus service links the campus to Milton Keynes and Bedford.
travelInfo.localTransport: The campus is rural but well-connected by bus. Cycling is popular on campus.

faculties: School of Aerospace, Transport and Manufacturing
School of Water, Energy, Environment and Agrifood

name: University of Cumbria
description: The University of Cumbria is a unique multi-campus university with sites in Carlisle, Lancaster, Ambleside, and London. It is the only UK university with a campus in a National Park (Lake District). The university is a leader in teacher training, forestry, and outdoor education, offering students a chance to learn in stunning natural environments.
entryRequirements: Typical offers range from BBC to CCC at A-level. The university is very inclusive and values practical experience, especially for vocational courses like nursing, teaching, and forestry. Interviews are common.
accommodation: Accommodation varies by campus. In Carlisle and Lancaster, there are halls of residence close to campus. The Ambleside campus offers a unique living experience in the heart of the Lake District. Prices are generally very affordable.
international: Cumbria welcomes international students and offers a supportive, close-knit community. The small class sizes mean international students get plenty of attention from tutors. The location is a huge draw for those who love nature.
studentLife: Student life is focused on the outdoors and community. The Students' Union runs clubs for hiking, climbing, and kayaking. Carlisle and Lancaster offer city amenities, while Ambleside is perfect for nature lovers.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. The university looks for a genuine passion for the subject and a commitment to the profession (for vocational courses).

travelInfo.train: Carlisle and Lancaster are on the West Coast Main Line (London-Glasgow). Ambleside is reached via Windermere station.
travelInfo.bus: Good local bus services connect campuses. The Stagecoach 555 bus through the Lakes is famous.
travelInfo.localTransport: Walking and cycling are the best ways to get around the campuses and local areas.

faculties: Institute of Business, Industry and Leadership
Institute of Education, Arts and Society

name: University of Derby
description: The University of Derby is a modern, innovative university located in the heart of the UK. It is known for its teaching excellence (TEF Gold) and strong industry connections, particularly in engineering and manufacturing (Rolls-Royce, Toyota). The university offers a supportive learning environment and state-of-the-art facilities, including a mock hospital ward and a crime scene house.

travelInfo.localTransport: Derby is compact and easy to get around. The Unibus is very convenient for students.

description: The University of Dundee is a world-class institution known for its research impact and outstanding student experience. international: Dundee has a strong international community with students from over 140 countries. The university offers scholarships and a dedicated International Advice Service. The city is welcoming and safe.

travelInfo.train: Dundee Station is a 5-minute walk from campus. Direct trains to Edinburgh (1h 15m), Glasgow (1h 30m), and London (6h).
travelInfo.bus: Seagate Bus Station is a 10-minute walk. Good local and national connections.
airports: Dundee Airport (10 mins by car - flights to London)
travelInfo.localTransport: Dundee is a compact city, perfect for walking. The campus is right in the city center.

travelInfo.train: Durham Station is on the East Coast Main Line. 15 mins to Newcastle, 3h to London King's Cross. The station is a short walk/bus ride from the colleges.
travelInfo.bus: Good local bus network. The 'Cathedral Bus' links the station, city center, and cathedral.
airports: Teesside International Airport (40 mins by car)
travelInfo.localTransport: Durham is a small, hilly city. Walking is the main way to get around, but be prepared for hills!

travelInfo.bus: Lothian Buses provide an excellent service throughout the city. A free shuttle bus connects Central Area and King's Buildings.
travelInfo.localTransport: The city is very walkable and bike-friendly. Trams connect the airport to the city center.
