studentLife: The Students' Union (QMSU) supports over 300 societies and sports clubs. The campus has its own bars, shops, and gym. East London offers trendy cafes, markets, and culture right on the doorstep.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. Interviews required for Medicine and Dentistry.

travelInfo.train: Mile End (Central, District, Hammersmith & City) and Stepney Green (District, Hammersmith & City) are 5 mins walk.
travelInfo.bus: Excellent 24-hour bus links (routes 25, 205) stop directly outside campus.
airports: Heathrow, Gatwick, Stansted (accessible via public transport)
travelInfo.localTransport: The campus location makes it easy to explore all of London via the tube network. Cycling is also popular.

faculties: Faculty of Humanities and Social Sciences

name: Queen's University Belfast
description: Queen's University Belfast is a prestigious Russell Group university located in the heart of Belfast. With a rich heritage dating back to 1845, it combines historic architecture with world-class research and facilities.

travelInfo.train: Botanic Station (5 min walk) connects to Great Victoria Street and Central.
travelInfo.bus: Metro 7/8/9 serve the university area. Airport Express 600 to City Airport.
travelInfo.localTransport: Belfast Bikes scheme available. Walkable campus.

entryRequirements: Typical offers range from A*AA to BBB. The university values potential and offers a variety of access routes.
accommodation: Guaranteed accommodation for first-year students at Elms BT1, BT2, and BT9 villages. High quality and affordable living.
international: A diverse community with over 3,800 international students from more than 80 countries.
studentLife: The Students' Union is the hub of campus life. Belfast offers a vibrant music scene, historic pubs, and easy access to the Causeway Coast.
admissions: Apply via UCAS.
faculties: Faculty of Arts, Humanities and Social Sciences
Faculty of Engineering and Physical Sciences
Faculty of Medicine, Health and Life Sciences

name: Royal Agricultural University
description: The Royal Agricultural University (RAU) is the oldest agricultural college in the English-speaking world, founded in 1845. Located in the beautiful Cotswolds, it is a leading center for education and research in agriculture, business, environment, and rural land management.
entryRequirements: Typical offers range from BBB to CCC. The university values practical experience and commitment to the land-based sector. BTECs and other vocational qualifications are welcomed.
accommodation: On-campus accommodation is available in Cirencester, ranging from catered halls to self-catered flats. Guaranteed for first-year students.
international: A welcoming community with students from over 45 countries. The university has strong global partnerships, particularly in China.
studentLife: The Students' Union (RAUSU) runs a variety of clubs, including the famous RAC Beagles and numerous sports teams. The campus bar is a central social hub.
admissions: Apply via UCAS.

travelInfo.train: Kemble Station is the nearest (10 mins drive/taxi). Direct trains to London Paddington (1h 15m).
travelInfo.bus: Local buses connect the campus to Cirencester town center.
travelInfo.localTransport: Car parking is available on campus. The campus is best accessed by car or taxi from the station.

faculties: School of Agriculture, Food and Environment
School of Equine Management and Science
School of Real Estate and Land Management

name: Ravensbourne University London
description: Ravensbourne University London is an innovative, industry-focused university located on the Greenwich Peninsula. Specializing in digital media and design, it champions creativity and collaboration, preparing students for careers in the creative industries.
entryRequirements: Typical offers range from Merit to Distinction in Foundation Diploma or A-levels. A portfolio is usually required to demonstrate creative potential.
accommodation: Ravensbourne partners with private providers like Scape to offer accommodation on the Greenwich Peninsula. Options are modern and close to campus.
international: A diverse community with students from many countries. The university offers support for international students to adjust to life in London.
studentLife: The Students' Union (Ravensbourne SU) organizes social events and societies. The location next to The O2 means world-class entertainment and dining are on the doorstep.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. Portfolios and interviews are key parts of the selection process.

travelInfo.train: North Greenwich Station (Jubilee Line) is right next door. 15 mins to Central London.
travelInfo.bus: North Greenwich bus station serves many local routes.
airports: London City Airport (15 mins via DLR/Tube)
travelInfo.localTransport: The IFS Cloud Cable Car and Uber Boat by Thames Clippers offer unique travel options.

name: Royal College of Art
description: The Royal College of Art (RCA) is the world's leading postgraduate university for art and design. With campuses in Kensington, Battersea, and White City, it offers an unparalleled environment for creativity, innovation, and research.
entryRequirements: Postgraduate only. A good undergraduate degree in a related subject is required, along with a strong portfolio and interview.
accommodation: The RCA does not have its own halls but offers a dedicated accommodation service to help students find private housing in London.
international: A truly global institution with students from over 60 countries. The RCA is a melting pot of cultures and creative perspectives.
studentLife: The RCA Students' Union (RCASU) organizes events, exhibitions, and social activities. Being in London means access to world-class galleries, museums, and creative industries.
admissions: Apply directly via the RCA website. The process is competitive and portfolio-based.

travelInfo.train: South Kensington and High Street Kensington (District, Circle, Piccadilly) for Kensington campus.
travelInfo.bus: Excellent bus links across all three campuses (Kensington, Battersea, White City).
travelInfo.localTransport: The RCA operates a shuttle bus between campuses. London's public transport network makes travel easy.

name: Royal Conservatoire of Scotland
description: The Royal Conservatoire of Scotland (RCS) is one of the world's top performing arts institutions, ranked consistently among the global elite. Located in Glasgow, it offers specialist training in music, drama, dance, production, and film.
entryRequirements: Admission is primarily by audition or interview. High standards of performance and potential are expected. Academic requirements vary by course.
accommodation: RCS partners with Base Glasgow to offer modern student accommodation a short walk from the Renfrew Street campus. Guaranteed for first-year undergraduates.
international: A diverse community with students from over 60 countries. The RCS is a global destination for performing arts education.
studentLife: The Students' Union (RCSSU) supports a tight-knit community. Glasgow is a UNESCO City of Music, offering an incredible cultural scene for students.
admissions: Apply via UCAS Conservatoires. Auditions are held in Glasgow and various international locations.

travelInfo.train: Glasgow Queen Street and Central stations are both within 10 mins walk.
travelInfo.bus: Buchanan Bus Station is 5 mins walk. Local buses stop on Hope Street.
travelInfo.localTransport: The Subway (Cowcaddens or Buchanan St) is nearby. The city is very walkable.

faculties: School of Drama, Dance, Production and Film

name: University of Reading
description: The University of Reading is known for its beautiful, award-winning Whiteknights campus and its high-quality research and teaching. It offers a diverse and inclusive environment with a strong sense of community and excellent links to industry.

travelInfo.train: Reading Station (Elizabeth Line/GWR) is a major hub.
travelInfo.bus: Routes 21/21a run 24/7. Campus shuttle available.
travelInfo.localTransport: Excellent bus network. Cycle friendly campus.

entryRequirements: Typical offers range from AAB to BBB. The university accepts a wide range of qualifications and offers foundation years.
accommodation: Guaranteed accommodation for first-year undergraduates. A wide range of options on and around the Whiteknights campus.
international: A global community with students from over 160 countries. The university offers pre-sessional English courses and dedicated support.
studentLife: RUSU supports over 150 societies and sports clubs. The campus has its own nightclub (3sixty), bars, and cafes.
admissions: Apply via UCAS.
faculties: Faculty of Humanities, Arts and Social Sciences

name: Robert Gordon University
description: Robert Gordon University (RGU) is a dynamic, modern university in Aberdeen, renowned for its focus on professional education and high graduate employability. Its stunning riverside campus at Garthdee provides state-of-the-art facilities.
entryRequirements: Typical offers range from BBB to CCC at Higher/A-level. The university is committed to widening access and accepts a broad range of vocational qualifications.
accommodation: RGU offers a variety of accommodation options at Garthdee and in the city center (e.g., Woolmanhill). Guaranteed for first-year students living away from home.
international: A global community with students from over 130 countries. RGU offers dedicated support and scholarships for international students.
studentLife: RGU:Union supports over 40 societies and sports clubs. The RGU SPORT facility is world-class. Aberdeen offers a mix of city culture and access to the stunning Scottish outdoors.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. RGU focuses on potential and career ambition.

travelInfo.train: Aberdeen Station is in the city center (30 mins bus to campus).
travelInfo.bus: First Bus routes 1 and 2 connect the city center to the Garthdee campus frequently.
travelInfo.localTransport: The campus is easily accessible by bike and has excellent cycling facilities.

faculties: School of Nursing, Midwifery and Paramedic Practice
School of Pharmacy and Life Sciences
The Scott Sutherland School of Architecture & Built Environment

name: University of Roehampton
description: The University of Roehampton offers a unique campus experience in south-west London. It is the only campus university in London with a collegiate system, fostering a strong sense of community within a beautiful parkland setting.

travelInfo.train: Barnes Station is a 15 min walk. fast trains to Waterloo.
travelInfo.bus: Routes 265, 419, 85, 72 stop on campus.
travelInfo.localTransport: Free university bus for students. London transport network.

entryRequirements: Typical offers range from BBC to CCC. The university has a flexible admissions policy and values individual potential.
accommodation: Guaranteed accommodation for first-year students. Rooms are located on campus within the colleges, offering a safe and social environment.
international: A diverse community with students from over 140 countries. The university offers specific support for international students.
studentLife: The collegiate system (Digby Stuart, Froebel, Southlands, Whitelands) provides a ready-made social network. The RSU runs numerous societies and sports clubs.
admissions: Apply via UCAS.
faculties: School of Arts, Humanities and Social Sciences
School of Life and Health Sciences

name: Royal Holloway, University of London
description: Royal Holloway, University of London, is famous for its stunning Founder's Building, modeled on the Chteau de Chambord. It offers a unique campus experience just 40 minutes from London. The university is a research powerhouse, particularly in the arts, humanities, and sciences.

travelInfo.train: Egham Station (20 min walk/shuttle). 40 mins to London Waterloo.
travelInfo.bus: RHU Shuttle & Local Routes (441/500) connect to station and Staines.
travelInfo.localTransport: Campus is walkable. Egham town nearby.

entryRequirements: Typical offers range from AAB to BBB. The university welcomes students with a diverse range of qualifications.
accommodation: Guaranteed accommodation for first-year undergraduates. Options range from the historic Founder's Building to modern halls.
international: A truly international community with students from over 130 countries. Comprehensive support includes airport pick-ups and orientation.
studentLife: The Students' Union runs over 100 societies and clubs. The campus has its own shop, bank, bars, and cafes.
admissions: Apply via UCAS.
faculties: School of Engineering, Physical and Mathematical Sciences
School of Law and Social Sciences
School of Life Sciences and the Environment
School of Performing and Digital Arts

name: Royal Veterinary College
description: The Royal Veterinary College (RVC) is the UK's largest and longest-established veterinary school, and one of the best in the world. With campuses in London (Camden) and Hertfordshire (Hawkshead), it offers a unique blend of urban and rural learning environments.

travelInfo.train: Camden: King's Cross St Pancras (10 mins). Hawkshead: Potters Bar (15 mins train from KX).
travelInfo.bus: Free shuttle bus connects Potters Bar station to Hawkshead campus.
travelInfo.localTransport: Shuttle service is efficient. London transport for Camden.

entryRequirements: Highly competitive. Typical offers AAA at A-level (Biology & Chemistry required). Work experience is also valued.
accommodation: Accommodation is available at both Camden and Hawkshead campuses. First-year students are prioritized.
international: A global leader in veterinary education, accredited in the UK, US (AVMA), and Europe (EAEVE). Students from 50+ countries.
studentLife: RVC SU organizes events across both campuses. Sports teams often train at Hawkshead's extensive facilities. A close-knit, animal-focused community.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. Interviews are a key part of the selection process.
faculties: Department of Clinical Science and Services
Department of Pathobiology and Population Sciences

name: University of Salford
description: The University of Salford is a dynamic institution with a strong focus on industry collaboration and real-world learning. Located just minutes from Manchester city center, it is the only university with a campus at MediaCityUK.

travelInfo.train: Salford Crescent (On Campus). MediaCity Tram stop nearby.
travelInfo.bus: Routes 50 (Free for students), 8, 67, 100.
travelInfo.localTransport: Excellent bus and tram links to Manchester and beyond.

entryRequirements: Typical offers range from BBB to CCC. The university is committed to widening participation and accepts a broad range of qualifications.
accommodation: Accommodation is available at Peel Park Quarter (on campus) and John Lester & Eddie Colman Courts. Guaranteed for first-year undergraduates.
international: A diverse community with students from over 100 countries. Salford offers specific scholarships and a dedicated international support team.
studentLife: The University of Salford Students' Union (USSU) runs numerous societies. Being next door to Manchester means endless entertainment, music, and culture.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. Salford looks for passion and potential, often interviewing for creative courses.
faculties: Salford School of Arts, Media and Creative Technology
School of Science, Engineering and Environment

name: St George's, University of London
description: St George's, University of London (now part of City St George's) is the UK's specialist health university. Based in Tooting, it shares a site with St George's Hospital, offering a unique immersion in clinical practice from day one.

travelInfo.train: Tooting Broadway (Northern Line) is a 5 min walk.
travelInfo.bus: Routes 493, G1 (Enter Hospital), 44, 77, 270.
travelInfo.localTransport: London Transport network. Tooting is well connected.

entryRequirements: Highly competitive, especially for Medicine. Typical offers AAA-ABB. UCAT/GAMSAT required for some courses. Interviews are standard.
accommodation: Horton Halls offers modern, self-catered accommodation a 15-minute walk from campus. Guaranteed for first-year undergraduates.
international: A diverse community with students from 60+ countries. St George's has a strong international reputation in medicine and health sciences.
studentLife: The Students' Union (SGSU) is active and inclusive. Being based in a hospital creates a unique, professional yet friendly atmosphere.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. St George's looks for academic ability and the values of the NHS constitution.
faculties: Institute of Medical and Biomedical Education
Molecular and Clinical Sciences Research Institute

name: University of Sheffield
description: The University of Sheffield is a world top-100 university and a member of the Russell Group. Known for its outstanding student experience, it has been voted the best Students' Union in the UK for many years running. The university has a strong reputation for engineering, social sciences, and arts.

travelInfo.train: Sheffield Station (10 mins Tram, 20 mins Walk). Major rail hub.
travelInfo.bus: Supertram (Blue/Yellow) and buses 120, 51, 52.
travelInfo.localTransport: Supertram is excellent. Walkable city center.

entryRequirements: Sheffield welcomes students with a range of qualifications. Typical A-level offers range from A*AA to BBB. The university is committed to widening participation and offers alternative routes for students from under-represented backgrounds.
accommodation: Sheffield offers excellent accommodation, including the popular Endcliffe and Ranmoor student villages. These offer a community feel with their own bars, dining halls, and shops. Guaranteed accommodation is available for first-year students.
international: Sheffield is a welcoming home for over 9,000 international students from 150 countries. The university offers a range of support services, including visa advice, English language support, and a dedicated International Student Support team.
studentLife: The University of Sheffield Students' Union has been voted the best in the UK for over a decade. It offers over 350 clubs and societies, its own cinema, and award-winning nightlife. Sheffield is also the greenest city in the UK, with the Peak District right on its doorstep.
admissions: Applications are via UCAS. The university looks for academic potential and a genuine interest in the subject. Some courses, such as Medicine and Architecture, require interviews or portfolios.

name: Sheffield Hallam University
description: Sheffield Hallam University is one of the UK's largest and most diverse universities. It is renowned for its applied learning approach, strong industry partnerships, and commitment to transforming lives.

travelInfo.train: Sheffield Station is a 2 min walk from City Campus.
travelInfo.bus: Sheffield Interchange (bus station) is opposite City Campus.
travelInfo.localTransport: City Campus is next to train/bus stations. Collegiate Campus connected by bus.

entryRequirements: Typical offers range from BBB to CCC. The university is inclusive and considers a wide range of vocational and academic qualifications.
accommodation: A wide range of halls available near both City and Collegiate campuses. Guaranteed accommodation for first-year students.
international: A vibrant international community with students from 100+ countries. Dedicated support for visas, careers, and integration.
studentLife: Sheffield Hallam Students' Union offers 100+ societies. Sheffield is known for its music scene, outdoor activities in the Peak District, and low cost of living.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. Sheffield Hallam values practical experience and potential, often interviewing for health and creative courses.
faculties: College of Business, Technology and Engineering
College of Social Sciences and Arts
College of Health, Wellbeing and Life Sciences

name: SOAS University of London
description: SOAS University of London is the leading Higher Education institution in Europe specialising in the study of Asia, Africa and the Near and Middle East. Located in Bloomsbury, it offers a unique global perspective.

travelInfo.train: Russell Square (Piccadilly) and King's Cross St Pancras are nearby.
travelInfo.bus: Numerous routes serve the Bloomsbury area.
travelInfo.localTransport: Central London location. Walking and Tube best.

entryRequirements: Typical offers range from AAB to BBB. SOAS values language skills and a genuine interest in the regions it studies.
accommodation: Accommodation available in SOAS-specific halls (e.g., Dinwiddy House) and University of London intercollegiate halls. Guaranteed for first-year undergraduates.
international: One of the most international universities in the world, with over 50% of students from outside the UK, representing 130+ countries.
studentLife: A politically active and culturally diverse Students' Union. The campus is a hub for debate, music, and art from around the world.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. Personal statements should demonstrate a strong interest in global affairs and specific regions.

name: Solent University
description: Solent University is a dynamic, modern university in the heart of Southampton, known for its focus on practical skills and career readiness. It is a global leader in maritime education through its Warsash Maritime School.

travelInfo.train: Southampton Central (15 min walk).
travelInfo.bus: Unilink buses connect campus, city, and airport.
travelInfo.localTransport: Unilink bus service is excellent for students.

entryRequirements: Typical offers range from BBB to CCC. Solent is inclusive and values vocational qualifications and real-world experience.
accommodation: Five student residences located within walking distance of the campus and city center. Guaranteed for first-year students.
international: A welcoming community with students from 100+ countries. Solent offers specific support for international students, including English language courses.
studentLife: Solent Students' Union is central to campus life. Southampton offers great shopping, nightlife, and water sports.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. Solent looks for passion and potential, often using portfolios and auditions for creative courses.
faculties: School of Business, Law and Society
School of Technology and Maritime Industries

name: University of Southampton
description: The University of Southampton is a founding member of the Russell Group and a world top-100 university. Known for its research intensity, it is a global leader in oceanography, electronics, and optoelectronics.

travelInfo.train: Southampton Airport Parkway (adjacent to campus/halls).
travelInfo.bus: Unilink U1 connects Highfield Campus to Airport, City, and Halls.
travelInfo.localTransport: Unilink bus pass included in halls fees. Cycling is popular.

accommodation: Over 6,000 rooms in halls like Glen Eyre and Wessex Lane. Guaranteed for first-year undergraduates who apply by deadline. Free bus pass often included.
international: Home to over 6,500 international students from 135+ countries. Meet & Greet service at Heathrow/Gatwick. International Study Centre available.
studentLife: SUSU supports 300+ societies. Campus has its own cinema, concert hall, and art gallery. Southampton offers maritime history, Westquay shopping, and parks.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. Personal statements are key. Interviews for Medicine/Health. High acceptance rate for a Russell Group uni.
faculties: Faculty of Engineering and Physical Sciences
Faculty of Environmental and Life Sciences

name: University of South Wales
description: The University of South Wales (USW) is a major player in UK higher education, with campuses in Cardiff, Newport, and Pontypridd. It focuses on preparing students for the professional world through hands-on learning and industry partnerships.

travelInfo.train: Treforest (PCI Campus), Cardiff Central (Cardiff Campus).
travelInfo.bus: Links between campuses and to Cardiff/Pontypridd.
travelInfo.localTransport: Train lines connect Treforest, Glyntaff, and Cardiff campuses.

accommodation: On-campus halls available at Treforest (Pontypridd). Private and partner accommodation options in Cardiff and Newport.
international: A diverse community with students from over 120 countries. USW offers generous international scholarships and dedicated support.

faculties: Faculty of Computing, Engineering and Science
Faculty of Business and Creative Industries
Faculty of Life Sciences and Education

name: University of St Andrews
description: The University of St Andrews is Scotland's oldest university, founded in 1413. It is unparalleled in its historic charm and academic prestige, consistently ranking among the top universities worldwide.

travelInfo.bus: Stagecoach 99 (Leuchars to St Andrews) runs frequently.
travelInfo.localTransport: The town is compact and walkable. Cycling is popular.

international: Scotland's most international university. Students from 120+ countries. 47% of students from outside UK, with strong US links.
studentLife: Rich in unique traditions like Raisin Weekend and the May Dip. Over 150 societies. Town and university are deeply integrated.
admissions: Apply via UCAS. References and personal statement are crucial. Some courses interview. Common Application accepted for US students.

name: Staffordshire University
description: Staffordshire University is a digital pioneer, known for its forward-thinking approach to education. With a strong focus on employability and digital skills, it offers industry-relevant courses in areas like games design, esports, and computing.

travelInfo.bus: First Potteries network connects city and campus.

accommodation: On-campus accommodation available at Stoke-on-Trent. Guaranteed for first-year students. Options range from standard rooms to en-suites.
international: A welcoming community with students from over 70 countries. Dedicated support for international students, including visa advice and English language support.
studentLife: The Students' Union runs 80+ societies, including a huge gaming community. Stoke offers affordable living and easy access to Manchester and Birmingham.

School of Health, Education, Policing and Sciences

faculties: Faculty of Arts, Business and Social Sciences
Faculty of Engineering and Physical Sciences
Faculty of Health and Medical Sciences

description: The University of Sussex is a leading research-intensive university located near Brighton in the South Downs National Park. Famous for its progressive history and interdisciplinary approach, it offers a vibrant and inclusive campus community.
